property.value: Explain the difference between constructor and setter injection?

entry.value: In constructor injection, partial injection is not allowed whereas it is allowed in setter injection.
The constructor injection doesnâ€™t override the setter property whereas the same is not true for setter injection.
Constructor injection creates a new instance if any modification is done. The creation of a new instance is not possible in setter injection.
In case the bean has many properties, then constructor injection is preferred. If it has few properties, then setter injection is preferred.
